text: - I'm Andy Phillips.
I run product strategy for Marquee,
which is our digital platform
for our global markets business,

and also, I lead our
financial cloud initiatives

for institutional
clients at Goldman Sachs.
One of the main focuses for us
has been around data management.

It's critical to everything
we do in financial services,
and we've been replatforming
our core data architecture onto AWS,
enabling us to deploy it at scale,

take advantage of the
latest cloud technologies,
serverless computing,
manage services,
and really increase the speed and scale
that we can operate our business.

We've built a collection
of managed services

that allow us to deploy that
infrastructure on demand
securely in the cloud environment,

achieve isolation across
our different businesses,
and then, scale on demand.

AWS allows us to achieve the
kind of business velocity
that we can't achieve on-prem.

Through the AWS Partner
Network, we can actually deliver

new and innovative
services to our clients,
to empower their own businesses,

by deploying software back
through the AWS Marketplace.

The Goldman Sachs
Financial Cloud for Data,
this enables both us and our clients,
you know, to rapidly achieve scale
in data management and analytics services.

It allows our developers and
developers of our clients
to remove the undifferentiated work
and really focus on delivering
new and innovative investment solutions,
and in short, we're democratizing access

to the same technology that we
use across the trading floor
to operate global markets.
